result.execSummary:
Kurt Martin Halvorson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Kurt Martin Halvorson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt Martin Halvorson

records.addlTxt: To County of Blue Earth, Minnesota

9:07 AM Defendant Kurt Martin Halvorson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case.  Defendant received the fugitive complaint.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Court accepts waiver of right to an attorney as knowingly and voluntarily made.  Defendant wishes to waive extradition.  Court recalls case at 9:14 am - Defendant signs waiver.  DA Fruehauf to sign waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of extradition as knowingly and voluntarily made.  Court to sign waiver.

10:35 AM Defendant Kurt Martin Halvorson appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video. Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case.  Defendant indicates retained Fritz Anderson as attorney but he could not make today's hearing.  Defendant asks for reset date. Court explains what waiver means. Defendant not signing waiver. Court sets new date.051922
Extradition hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant Kurt Martin Halvorson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Defendant received the fugitive complaint.  Defendant asks for attorney. Court adjourns matter.
Extradition hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Signed Order Finding Probable Cause to Hold Fugitive
